sentences.sentence: The NATO summit in Lithuania ends with Ukraine one step closer to membership of the military alliance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Well-known BBC anchor Hugh Edwards has been identified by his wife as the person at the centre of a sexual photo scandal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The NATO summit in Lithuania has ended without a timeline for Ukraine's membership.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But the alliance says it is committed to the idea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Although there was no dramatic breakthrough on the final day, Kiev did win fresh pledges of weapons to help fight Russia and longer-term security guarantees.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: NATO's wealthiest members, the G7, formalized the offer in a joint declaration.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Ukraine is now closer to NATO than ever before.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Allies reaffirmed that Ukraine will become a member of NATO and agreed to remove the requirement for a membership action plan. This will change Ukraine's membership path from a two-step process to a one-step process. We will issue an invitation for Ukraine to join NATO when allies agree that conditions are met.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's Vladimir Zelensky heard similar expressions of support when he met with U.S.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: President Joe Biden. He later described the day's developments as a bridge to NATO membership. The other focus of the summit was Sweden's bid to join the military alliance, which had been blocked by Turkey.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan finally agreed to support Stockholm's bid, but on Wednesday warned his parliament was unlikely to ratify the accession before it returned from recess in October.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Yes, but.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: This could be the headline of this NATO leader's summit in Vilnius for all the thorny challenges they are facing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Sweden got the green light to join NATO and become the 32nd member of the alliance after Turkey lifted its veto on the eve of the summit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But no concrete timeframe was given to them for their rat eve of the summit. But no concrete time frame was given to them for their ratification of the accession protocol by the Turkish Parliament. President Erdogan said that further steps should be made by Sweden but he also somehow linked the process of ratifying the accession protocol by the Turkish Parliament to the one of the United States Congress that would give the green lights to the United States to sell F-16 fighter jets to Ankara.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: On the other side, when it comes to Ukraine, the leaders of NATO said with one voice that Ukraine's future is NATO, but only when allies agree and when the conditions are met. Which means we don't know when.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: This is something that infuriated the Ukrainian President Zelensky, who expected something more this time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The truth is that NATO leaders are quite divided over this issue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But in the end, they said with one voice again that they will continue to support Ukraine as long as it takes.

sentences.sentence: Hugh Edward's wife confirmed that he was the high-profile anchor accused of paying a young person for sexually explicit photos.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In a statement to the media, she said her husband had been hospitalized in recent days after the allegations were published in a tabloid paper.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Police now say that after initial inquiries, there's no basis for a criminal case against Edwards.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02

sentences.sentence: A tree knocked down in northern Italy. The region has been hit by heavy rains and high winds

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: that have caused extensive damage to both vegetation and property. It's a summer of extremes across Europe as violent storms follow record-breaking heat that has seen a number of people injured.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Eastern France was lashed by the same weather system, with torrential downpours in Dijon, Strasbourg and other cities after days of soaring temperatures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: While rain has brought relief to some areas, much of the continent remains in the grip of a sustained heatwave, like here in Romania.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In Spain, where the mercury has risen above 40 degrees at times, people have been going to the beach at night in search of some respite.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The long-term effects of heat waves that are occurring more frequently is evident in the Alps. Swiss scientists say glaciers are melting at an increasing rate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Nowadays, almost every year is an extreme year where we see a lot of melting and the top of this was reached in the summer of 22 when Swiss glaciers lost about 6% of their total volume.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: So this was an absolute record that we didn't thought it would be possible. Milder winters and decreasing annual snowfalls have exacerbated the problem both in Switzerland and other Alpine countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: An airdrop of food packages to people in need.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The United Nations says around 122 million more people have been driven into hunger through a combination of climate crises, the COVID pandemic and global conflicts, including the war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In its latest report on food security and nutrition, the Food and Agriculture Organization found that 735 million people around the world were facing hunger in 2022, compared to 613 million in 2019. Asia and Africa remain the worst affected continents. And almost 30% of the global population, some 2.5 billion people, do not have constant access to food. The report suggests increased urbanization is affecting how and what people eat, with almost 7 in 10 projected to live in cities in the coming years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It says there's a risk the UN's Sustainable Development Goal of ending world hunger by 2030 may not be met.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Music is a universal language that reaches the hearts of everyone, regardless of nationality or culture.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Since 1997 in Sarajevo, the Roads of Friendship project has been closely intertwined with the Ravenna Festival, bringing a message of peace and unity between cultures through the work of the renowned conductor Riccardo Mutti.
